blockingComponent.text: Looks like there are no reviews available yet. But do not worry! You will be notified as soon as there is something to see here.
blockingComponent.subtitle: Wee see you soon!

bestDayWeek.info: "Best Performing Day" means the day of the week in which your experience was rated the highest. A 4.50 rating is considered a good to excelent rating, while a 4.70+ is considered as an amazing rating. Rating between 4.20 and 4.50 reads as an "OK location/brand", and ratings below 4.20 suggests that the location/brand is badly perceived by its consumers.

chartLabel.green: Lovers / Most Valuable Clients (action: keep wowing)
chartLabel.blue: Unhappy Customers, but they recommend (Missing that Wow Element)
chartLabel.yellow: Happy Customers, but don't recommend (action: Boost Word-of-Mouth)

charts.wordCloudError: There no words to build the word cloud.

crossAnalysis.info: OKR stands for Objective and Key Results and in this report is understood as the 4 key metrics that assess Emotional Connection. For all questions that have a Likert Scale (1 to 5) as answer option, the goal is to have 70% of Highly Satisfied consumers. Below that, the location lacks in emotional connection with its client and, thus, is at risk of losing clients.

sections.title: What drives your Wow Factor up or down?
Why your price point might be considered too high for some of your consumers
Why aren't your consumers referring you to friends and/or family?
Why you might be losing recurrence and retention?

crossAnalysis.bestDayTitle: What's your best performing day of the week as for Wowing your consumers?
crossAnalysis.frequencyTitle: Are your customers loyal to your brand?
crossAnalysis.tabsInstruction: Click on the rating below (5 to 1) and see what are the category ratings your consumers are giving. To check what's driving your Wow Factor DOWN, see what's the impact that the product, service and physical environment have for those rating 3, 2 or 1 for Wow Factor.
crossAnalysis.goalText: 70% (at least) of your consumers should be rating 5 stars. Below you can see the rating breakdown per category (Product, Service and Physical Environment).

login.validEmailField: A valid email address is required.

from100to0.title: From -100 to 0
from100to0.text: The pains are huge and the medium/long term risks are enormous. Customers do not return and do not recommend, and their new customer acquisition cost is high.
from100to0.text2: Frustrating and lousy experience. I will never recommend it. I may even go back, rarely, but only for lack of choice.

from1to50.title: From 1 to 50
from1to50.text: There are some pains to be observed. It's far from charming, and you still need to understand the journey, interests, and what customers are looking for.
from1to50.text2: I may have liked it, and I may even point it out, but I got the impression of a 'however.' I’ll come back, but with proviso.

from51to75.title: From 51 to 75
from51to75.text: There are small pains to be observed. The customer sees the quality, but does not perceive the enchantment. The establishment needs to find its strength.
from51to75.text2: Very good Product, Service, and Structure; but lacked that something more. I’d still certainly recommend it.

from76to100.title: From 76 to 100
from76to100.text: Perfect product, service, and delivery structure for the expectation communicated to the public. The service was seen as a shocking experience.
from76to100.text2: I had a great experience, and it made my day better. I totally recommend this company.
